body:
Sorry for that! Of course, it wasn't meant to happen. Created a new PR with my two commits only: 
https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1583

@borisheithecker thank you - I just tested locally and when this PR is rebased, the changeset shows the two isolated commits. Please close #1583, the reference was more meant for the future - in general I find it easier to review PRs, that don't contain merges from master and if sync is really necessary, I prefer a rebase instead of a merge, but that is my personal preference.

Are your sure your solution passes with the fix and does not without it?

I've tried it and changed my test case according to your suggestion. If I comment out the ProxyClassLoader.findClass(String name) override, the test still passes, regardless if run with java 8 or 11.0.4.

(I did some digging in the existing sources before as well, and, though I may not have been thorough enough, it seems to me that you can't easily create a unit test for this fix. You'd have have to change more code in ProxyClassLoader only for the sake of testing.)

Yes - check this branch: https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/netbeans/tree/pr-1565-unittest

This is the procedure I just ran:

Enable JDK9+ builds:

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ cat ~/.nbbuild.properties 
permit.jdk9.builds=true

#nbjdk.home=/home/matthias/bin/jdk1.8.0_201/
```

Check java version on path:

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ java -version
openjdk version "11.0.4" 2019-07-16
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.4+11-post-Ubuntu-1ubuntu219.04)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.4+11-post-Ubuntu-1ubuntu219.04, mixed mode, sharing)
```

No explicit `JAVA_HOME` set:

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ echo $JAVA_HOME

matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ 
```

Three commits (to from you, the middle from me). I reordered the patches, so that the unittests come first in the history.

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ git log -n 3 --oneline
edb52bd4d57e (HEAD -> pr-1565-unittest) Fix for ProxyClassLoader to implement findClass(String name) required for Java 11.
d0270239bf87 Adjust unittest to fail before fix and work after fix
09f7a8da1ece Added JUnit test case.
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ 
```

First go to your unittests (now the first commit):

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ git checkout 09f7a8da1ece

[...]

matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ git clean -f -x -d

[...]

matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ ant

[...]

matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans$ cd platform/o.n.bootstrap/

matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ ant -Dtest.type=unit -Dtest.includes=org/netbeans/ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest.java test-single

[...]

-do-junit-single:
    [junit] Testsuite: org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest
    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0,22 sec
    [junit] 

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 14 seconds
```

The unittests runs clean, although the patch is not present yet. No switch to the commit, that imports my suggested patch:

```
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ git checkout d0270239bf87
Vorherige Position von HEAD war 09f7a8da1ece Added JUnit test case.
HEAD ist jetzt bei d0270239bf87 Adjust unittest to fail before fix and work after fix
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ ant -Dtest.type=unit -Dtest.includes=org/netbeans/ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest.java test-single

[...]

-do-junit-single:
    [junit] Testsuite: org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest
    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0,206 sec
    [junit] 
    [junit] Testcase: testPackageAnnotation(org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest):	FAILED
    [junit] Annotation not found
    [junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Annotation not found
    [junit] 	at org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest.testPackageAnnotation(ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest.java:85)
    [junit] 	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    [junit] 	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
    [junit] 	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    [junit] 	at org.netbeans.junit.NbTestCase.access$200(NbTestCase.java:77)
    [junit] 	at org.netbeans.junit.NbTestCase$2.doSomething(NbTestCase.java:460)
    [junit] 	at org.netbeans.junit.NbTestCase$1Guard.run(NbTestCase.java:386)
    [junit] 	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
    [junit] 
    [junit] 
    [junit] Test org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest FAILED

BUILD FAILED
/home/matthias/src/netbeans/nbbuild/templates/common.xml:813: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/matthias/src/netbeans/nbbuild/templates/common.xml:805: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/matthias/src/netbeans/nbbuild/templates/common.xml:836: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/matthias/src/netbeans/nbbuild/templates/common.xml:833: Some tests failed; see details above.

Total time: 4 seconds

```

Now unittest fail - so now switch to the commit, that brings in your fix:

```

atthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ git checkout edb52bd4d57e
Vorherige Position von HEAD war d0270239bf87 Adjust unittest to fail before fix and work after fix
HEAD ist jetzt bei edb52bd4d57e Fix for ProxyClassLoader to implement findClass(String name) required for Java 11.
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ ant -Dtest.type=unit -Dtest.includes=org/netbeans/ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest.java test-single

[...]

-do-junit-single:
    [junit] Testsuite: org.netbeans.ProxyClassLoaderNB11PackageAnnotationsTest
    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0,389 sec
    [junit] 

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 9 seconds
matthias@athena:~/src/netbeans/platform/o.n.bootstrap$ 
```
Uhhh, that sounds nice :). I'm exited.

Right Link [https://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/new-javac-warning-for-setting-an-older-source-without-bootclasspath](https://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/new-javac-warning-for-setting-an-older-source-without-bootclasspath)

@Akshay-Gupta-Oracle You should create a branch from next time :) You should use your master branch to sync the upstream master branch before you create a new branch. Please see (Keeping your own fork in sync with Apache GitHub repo): https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=74681408
Build took to long so Travis decided to kill it, unfortunately I have no permission to restart it.
@Ihsahn retriggered the failing test.

Firstly, please don't merge this until I've had a chance to do the two post-release commits (sig tests and spec versions) and re-opened master.  That might require an update here.

Then we need to work out how we ship this for 11.2.  Initial thought is to merge this to master, then cherry-pick locally, and then a second PR to release112?  We'll also need a vote on revised sources (there might be other fixes to get in), and we need to figure out how to sign the resulting updated NBM(s).

A temporary UC for testing the fix might be useful?

Okay, I see my mistake (forgot one "/"). I'll submit another commit to the
PR on Monday.
Boris

wrote:

> @Ihsahn retriggered the failing test.

thx!
@matthiasblaesing can you take a look?

I created [NETBEANS-3296](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3296) to track all the errors related to using the JavaFX Javadoc and Sources in NetBeans. An identical copy of the issue description is on GitHub at [jgneff/netbeans-doc-src](https://github.com/jgneff/netbeans-doc-src).
@tmysik Could you please review this although we can't merge this into the master branch yet?
@tmysik Could you please review this although we can't merge this into the master branch yet?
@junichi11 I'll reopen master in a couple of days. Need to merge #1594 and then increment spec versions first.
@neilcsmith-net I see. Thank you for the information :)

@tmysik 

> Is this ready for review? It is WIP...

Yes, I did it to disable the "Merge pull request" button, but I'll click the "Ready for review" button later(after I fixed the below problem) because you know that we can't merge this yet :)

> What is the use-case for public mymethod() in an interface?

Do nothing because an interface can't have `private` and `protected` methods.

I realized that abstract class cases are missing. So, I'll fix it later (maybe, tomorrow).

Thanks!
With the updated PR this looks good (i.e.: test fails without the patch and succeeds with it). Thank you. I'll mark this for inclusion into Netbeans 11.3 once master is opened for commits.
How/where should the temporary UC be? Could we put it on our netbeans-vm.apache.org? Or maybe simply in our tools repo: https://github.com/apache/netbeans-tools?
What is the progress of this PR here and how can I help here?

Fixed. Use `FileObject` instead of `File`.
I realized the file name is absolute path if the working directory is null (i.e. the target file or directory is not in the PHP project). So, I've also fixed it. Thanks.

@junichi11 

> Fixed. Use `FileObject` instead of `File`.
> I realized the file name is absolute path if the working directory is null (i.e. the target file or directory is not in the PHP project). So, I've also fixed it. Thanks.

Perfect!

Well, it is hard to say. It requires some dedication and coordination. Right now we have a ProjectFactory2 interface to implemented by project providers, but most projects do not even implement ProjectFactory correctly. This is easily fixable for Maven and Gradle projects, but the others needs some serious attention.
@ebarboni added Cherry Pick label. If we shipped an NB 11.2 update to `org-netbeans-modules-apisupport-harness.nbm` I'm assuming this would get picked up OK?
ok,this is to flag for in case of update

If I remember correctly, log messages on level SEVERE raise an "exception" bubble in the IDE. While this might be helpful, I as a user would prefer to have the message in the place where I can do something about it. I think it would be good to see if the either the value `WizardDescriptor.PROP_ERROR_MESSAGE` can be enhanced or if another output channel is needed.
@neilcsmith-net Can we merge PRs for 11.3? Or, do we have to wait for #1593?

@junichi11 as announced, master is open. The PR I would have liked to prioritize was #1589 but that's been closed. NETBEANS-3257 is the one urgent fix we need.  #1593 is just a possible addition if we have a patch update.  Either will need careful cherry picking to release branch anyway as the spec version change has been made on master which means we can't sync any more - so other commits on master shouldn't cause issues if you want to start merging.
@neilcsmith-net I see. I'll merge them later. Thank you!
Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/6e760f6b4d5b032bfb8a8f88b1604318c5e13fa6. Thank you.
Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/f2611e358c181935500ea4d9d9142fb850504a72. Thank you.

@tmysik We can merge PRs into the master branch: [https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/f2df2f44fa7c77a375446dbff75fd08c6662a7acc7da0cc2b65ee98e@<dev.netbeans.apache.org>](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/f2df2f44fa7c77a375446dbff75fd08c6662a7acc7da0cc2b65ee98e@<dev.netbeans.apache.org>)

So, could you please merge it if it is OK with you? Thanks!

> Loosing that plugin from the project could result that some listeners on the JavaEE project preferences would not be removed.

Wouldn't using `WeakListeners` be a more suitable choice?
Looks good to me.

PR has conflicts with master, there was no activitiy for about 6 months and the commits still have invalid author information. Closing for now, feel free to reopen if you want to continue work on this.
No reply in over 6 months.
@junichi11 Thanks a lot!
Very nice. The results look relatively sane AFAICS.

@JaroslavTulach Thank you for the insight! Though I think weak listeners are great, probably not here. I made more debugging on this. It seems the JavaEE support holds a reference to the WebBrowserProvider even after it got removed from the project just in order to gracefully remove that listener. The problem is my sloppy handling of the preference field of that object.

@BradWalker I'm currently working through this - one request: Don't merge branches after you created a PR (if not for a very good reason). I tried to rebase your patch and the merge of Erics branch makes it unnessary difficult.

Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/f1592df218c1add0f4088c0cb2f58eed02f649d4. Thank you.

I'm not sure if I asked about it in the past - you are doing valuable work and I understood, that you plan to continue. It would be helpful if you could get a ICLA on file. See here: https://www.apache.org/licenses/contributor-agreements.html
Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/33f8ee20c31f67ff0e449f6d21575d1d29a28f38. Thank you.
Merged via https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/df75397e950980e7de225d02adf879d1d301d7af. Thank you.
Rebased onto master and did the squashing. I plan to merge this mid next week if no-one objects till then.
Fix looks sane, JNA was updated and the major release version was bumped as there were incompatible changes done. Thank you.
@jlahoda @jtulach could you please see if this makes sense to you?
Thank you @matthiasblaesing, when we got the final blessing from the Gradle team contacts (@jlstrater and/or @aweida) I'm going to update the licensinfo files.
Looks OK to me.
Thank you.
I've changed the partial reparser to be off by default, and I think it would be good to merge it into the master - it would make it much easier to find pending problems.
Hey @matthiasblaesing thanks for the feedback! Also, I filed an ICLA this weekend, FYI.
@BradWalker great! Thank you.

Yes, the package needs to be defined, too. Looks good to me.
Regards,
Boris

On Sun, 3 Nov 2019 at 19:55, Matthias Bläsing <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @borisheithecker <https://github.com/borisheithecker> please have a look

>
> JDK8 without Fix: Test passes
> JDK11 without Fix: Test fails
> JDK8 with Fix: Test passes
> JDK11 with Fix: Test passes
>
> This is IMHO the expected outcome. Does that look sane to you?

Thank you.
@blackleg could you please rebase this PR on current master? At least two failing tests should be fixed, which might already clear this PR.
Given comments on this, possible 11.2 patch update?
Yes, that would be good I think.
I think this is safe for a point release. In the worst case the exception is exchanged for wrong syntax highlighting, but the user should then still be able to work with his/her file.

@matthiasblaesing Maybe, we can add unit tests to the smarty module: ```diff diff --git a/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl new file mode 100644 index 0000000000..c476b594d0 --- /dev/null +++ b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl @@ -0,0 +1 @@ + diff --git a/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl.errors b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl.errors new file mode 100644 index 0000000000..607da0e3dc --- /dev/null +++ b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_01.tpl.errors @@ -0,0 +1 @@ +Detected parser errors in the file: diff --git a/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_02.tpl b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_02.tpl new file mode 100644 index 0000000000..f6bb7c35a4 --- /dev/null +++ b/php/php.smarty/test/unit/data/testfiles/parserErrors/testParserNETBEANS3335_02.tpl @@ -0,0 +1 @@ +

Thomas [asked me](https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/netbeans-dev/201911.mbox/%3C1faff55e-7944-97f8-741b-ed887299adf9%40gmail.com%3E) to test this pull request. Below are the results of my tests using the [Non-Modular Maven](https://github.com/openjfx/samples/tree/master/IDE/NetBeans/Non-Modular/Maven) project of the [JavaFX samples](https://github.com/openjfx/samples) repository. Once we resolve the issues with this first project, I can test the other sample projects described in [NETBEANS-3296](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3296).

I ran the tests with OpenJDK 13.0.1 on Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS. I did not install the *nb-javac* plug-in so as to avoid the exceptions it encounters. For the Java Platform Javadoc, I left the default entry created by NetBeans, which lists only the *docs* directory of the JDK.

![platform-javadoc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421808-cd823f80-0153-11ea-84dd-e438032bd4d6.png)

Before downloading the JavaFX Javadoc and Sources, neither were available to NetBeans, as expected.

I right-clicked the Dependencies node in the Project window and selected *Download Javadoc*. The Javadoc artifacts were downloaded to the local Maven cache under the directory *~/.m2/repository/org/openjfx*.

```
javafx-base/13.0.1/javafx-base-13.0.1-javadoc.jar
javafx-base/13.0.1/javafx-base-13.0.1-javadoc.jar.sha1
javafx-controls/13.0.1/javafx-controls-13.0.1-javadoc.jar
javafx-controls/13.0.1/javafx-controls-13.0.1-javadoc.jar.sha1
javafx-fxml/13.0.1/javafx-fxml-13.0.1-javadoc.jar
javafx-fxml/13.0.1/javafx-fxml-13.0.1-javadoc.jar.sha1
javafx-graphics/13.0.1/javafx-graphics-13.0.1-javadoc.jar
javafx-graphics/13.0.1/javafx-graphics-13.0.1-javadoc.jar.sha1
```

The Javadoc badges appeared on those dependencies without the *-linux.jar* platform classifier.

![dependencies-javadoc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421797-cc511280-0153-11ea-9c1d-4c6de8f33044.png)

To my surprise, the Javadoc then displayed perfectly even before attaching the Sources! I had previously thought that NetBeans always got the Javadoc from the comments in the source code.

The Javadoc window showed the full description when selecting the `setScene` method.

![javadoc-setScene](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421801-cce9a900-0153-11ea-8647-ccafe55520f7.png)

The full description was displayed when selecting the `show` method.

![javadoc-show](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421803-cd823f80-0153-11ea-8741-fa448f451a6a.png)

Clicking the toolbar button to show the documentation in an external Web browser opened my browser to the correct location.

![browser-setScene](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421794-cc511280-0153-11ea-8523-1572daf7e980.png)

Furthermore, the Javadoc for the Java Platform was found with the default entry created by NetBeans. Previously, you had to edit the Platform Javadoc and add the specific Java module directories for the information to display correctly.

![javadoc-getClass](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421800-cce9a900-0153-11ea-88a8-2d87a85659f1.png)

Clicking through to the Sources showed only the Compiled Code, as expected.

![compiled-code-setScene](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421796-cc511280-0153-11ea-9bfb-abbe3221553c.png)

Next, I right-clicked the Dependencies node in the Project window and selected *Download Sources*. The Sources artifacts were downloaded to the local Maven cache under the directory *~/.m2/repository/org/openjfx*.

```
javafx-base/13.0.1/javafx-base-13.0.1-sources.jar
javafx-base/13.0.1/javafx-base-13.0.1-sources.jar.sha1
javafx-controls/13.0.1/javafx-controls-13.0.1-sources.jar
javafx-controls/13.0.1/javafx-controls-13.0.1-sources.jar.sha1
javafx-fxml/13.0.1/javafx-fxml-13.0.1-sources.jar
javafx-fxml/13.0.1/javafx-fxml-13.0.1-sources.jar.sha1
javafx-graphics/13.0.1/javafx-graphics-13.0.1-sources.jar
javafx-graphics/13.0.1/javafx-graphics-13.0.1-sources.jar.sha1
```

The Sources badges appeared on those dependencies without the *-linux.jar* platform qualifier.

![dependencies-javadoc-sources](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421798-cce9a900-0153-11ea-8a87-31b932717724.png)

Here I started to see some unexpected behavior. Selecting the `show()` method in the *App.java* file no longer shows the method description as it did before.

![javadoc-show-no-description](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421806-cd823f80-0153-11ea-98c6-3fc0d232364c.png)

Selecting the `setScene` method still shows the full description in the Javadoc window, but *Ctrl-clicking* the method does not navigate to its location in the source file. It opens the source file with the cursor on the first line, even though it navigated to the correct location in the Compiled Code view previously.

![source-setScene](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421809-cd823f80-0153-11ea-803d-8bc083ec886e.png)

To see what's happening, I deleted the Javadoc from the Maven cache and left just the Sources. I closed and reopened the project.

![dependencies-sources](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421799-cce9a900-0153-11ea-9b08-693219ec2b55.png)

Now we see the same problems. The `show` method has no description.

![javadoc-show-sources-only](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421807-cd823f80-0153-11ea-98d0-492b2a017009.png)

The Ant projects in NetBeans 11.2, though, are able to show the Javadoc for this method using only the comments in the source code, as shown in the screenshot below. I expected the Maven project to provide the same information. Note that you can tell whether the Javadoc and Sources are available by looking at whether the corresponding toolbar buttons are enabled. In the images above and below, only the Sources button is enabled. No Javadoc is attached.

![ant-javadoc-show](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421770-bb080600-0153-11ea-9aa3-0b835b402d9b.png)

The `setScene` method displays no Javadoc at all, even though Javadoc comments are available in the source code.

![javadoc-setScene-sources-only](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1413266/68421802-cce9a900-0153-11ea-90b8-07a21dfeb4b7.png)

Navigating to the `show` method's source works, but for `setScene` the file still just opens to the first line. The two methods in the source code are defined as follows.

```Java
    /**
     * Specify the scene to be used on this stage.
     */
    @Override final public void setScene(Scene value) {
        Toolkit.getToolkit().checkFxUserThread();
        super.setScene(value);
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override public final void show() {
        super.show();
    }
```

How should the Javadoc be displayed now? I'm guessing at the following algorithm based on the results of the all tests I've been doing here and for [NETBEANS-3296](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3296).

* If the Javadoc is attached and an entry exists for the selected item, use the HTML to display the Javadoc.
* Otherwise, if the Sources are attached and there are Javadoc comments for the selected item, use those comments to display the Javadoc.
* Otherwise, prompt the user to attach the Javadoc or Sources. In the Javadoc window and code completion, prompt the user to attach the Javadoc. In the Compiled Code view, prompt the user to attach the Sources.

I would prefer fixing the problems that occur after downloading the Sources: the Javadoc description disappears and the source navigation fails. I know, easy for me to say. :smiley: We could, however, fix these in pieces and open new issues for those problems.

I just ran some more tests to make sure that this pull request doesn't break the technique I use to work on the [JavaFX Graphics](https://github.com/jgneff/javafx-graphics) module in NetBeans. The work-around is to create an Ant-based project and add the individual JAR files to the Module or Compile Classpath, attach the appropriate Javadoc and Sources directories to each JAR file, remove the Javadoc and Sources from the Global Library, and uninstall the *nb-javac* plug-in. That still works as described in the *Ant Non-Modular* and *Ant-Modular* sections of [NETBEANS-3296](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3296).
This PR should be closed in favor of this PR https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1620

I added @ebarboni to the review list as he wrote this. But if it's working everywhere good from my perspective. Longer term refactoring the json stuff into its own target might make sense, and still not sure we want skip existing set to false either.

Dear @matthiasblaesing please review the changes in the licenseinfo files.

Info: Add "-J-Djava.enable.partial.reparse=true" to the command line options in netbeans.conf to enable it. As I'm living on the weekly updated NetBeans master builds, I've turned it on for myself, in order to be able to report if something goes south.

After some digging, here are my findings. The algorithm to find the javadoc goes as follows:

1. If there is source for the code element attached, try to use that first (this happens in [ElementJavadoc::getElementDoc](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.sourceui/src/org/netbeans/api/java/source/ui/ElementJavadoc.java#L742)).

2. Otherwise, if the source contains no javadoc for the requested element or finding the requested code element in the source fails, try to use the javadoc.

3. Otherwise, if the code element is a method, recurse upward the type hierarchy.

4. Otherwise, display the "Attach Javadoc..." popup.

I think the order is sensible, changing it would probably be too disruptive.

I traced the execution after requesting javadoc for `stage.setScene(scene)` to [ElementHandle::resolveImpl](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.source.base/src/org/netbeans/api/java/source/ElementHandle.java#L177), where the method signature the user clicked on  (`{ "javafx.stage.Stage", "setScene", "(Ljavafx/scene/Scene;)V" }`) does not match the signature parsed from Stage.java (`{ "javafx.stage.Stage", "setScene", "(LScene;)V" }`). The reason the parameter from the JavaFX source is not fully qualified is because javac reports it as `TypeKind.ERROR`, see [ClassFileUtil](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.source.base/src/org/netbeans/modules/java/source/usages/ClassFileUtil.java#L277).
In fact, javac reports **every** reference type from Stage.java as `TypeKind.ERROR`, even types like `String` that are not part of the JavaFX source. I haven't checked yet, but I assume this is also the reason why source navigation fails (notice that only jumping to methods that take reference types fails, others work fine).

About `stage.show()`: No reference type parameters, so it should work fine. It uses `{@inheritDoc}` though, and javac fails to resolve the superclass `Window` inside [ElementJavadoc::getInherited](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.sourceui/src/org/netbeans/api/java/source/ui/ElementJavadoc.java#L1078) (`type.getSuperclass().getKind()` returns `TypeKind.ERROR`). There is no other content in the javadoc of the method, so only the method signature is displayed.

That's where I stopped, the next step would probably be to see what's so special about Stage.java that javac can't parse its type references.

@matthiasblaesing
The javac errors are not caused by this PR: Renaming the source artifact in .m2 to `javafx-graphics-13-linux-sources.jar` (so NetBeans finds it) leads to the same failures in stock NetBeans 11.2: source navigation jumps to the top of the file and javadoc is only displayed for methods without reference type parameters. With this PR there is at least a fallback to javadoc jars when javac can't resolve type references.

I did not check why the Ant project works, but fixing the javac errors has to be done anyway.

While looking through the source I also found two other places that deal with javadoc that need to be adapted to javadoc 9+ output (namely [HTMLJavadocParser::parseClass](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.sourceui/src/org/netbeans/api/java/source/ui/HTMLJavadocParser.java#L281) and [JavadocHelper.TextStream](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.source.base/src/org/netbeans/modules/java/source/JavadocHelper.java#L274)). I'd like to consolidate the logic a bit, I think I have a way that doesn't break any public API. But leaving those places in for now shouldn't have a huge negative impact. I'm for merging this PR and I'll do a follow up PR when time permits.

Thank you for the great research, Thomas. Thanks especially for documenting how this is supposed to work according to the code. So it's the opposite of my guess—Sources first, then Javadoc. That makes sense, as many of the Javadoc comments are not published in their Javadoc HTML.

I also tried to figure out what's supposed to happen, but by comparing NetBeans with IntelliJ IDEA when they both appear to be working. I posted my comparison as [Apache NetBeans & IntelliJ IDEA](https://github.com/jgneff/netbeans-doc-src/tree/master/netbeans-intellij). I found the comparison interesting, but I don't think you'll see anything you don't already know.

The point about attached Javadoc substituting missing comments in the attached Source is subtle, great find! I revised the algorithm in [my comment](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1548#issuecomment-552133026) to reflect this. I verified that this is supposed to be happening with `stage.setMinWidth(0)` (no reference type parameter, so it's not accidental).
